constraints: Completeness ("max"): The response is as exhaustive as reasonable, covering essentially everything relevant and treating omissions as errors.
Method ("origin"): The response enhances the task by uncovering how the subject arose, why it looks this way now, and how past decisions shaped the present state.
Directional ("jog"): The response modifies the task to interpret the intent and carry it out directly without asking follow-up questions.
